message: I'm offering you a product for $1000000. It's a one-time opportunity to make a significant profit. I'm confident you'll be pleased with the purchase. Will you take it?
I'd like to wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.

I understand your caution, but I assure you that this product has the potential to be a great investment. I'm willing to offer you a second chance to purchase it for the same price of $1000000. I'm not lowering the price, but I'm giving you the opportunity to reconsider. What do you say?
I appreciate your confidence in the product, but I'm still unsure about its quality. I'd like to wait and see if the next product is any better.

I'm glad you're being cautious, but I think this next product is worth considering. It's a high-quality item, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price of $1000000. I'm not trying to pressure you, but I think this one has the potential to be a game-changer. Take a chance and see what it can do for you.
I'm willing to take a chance on this product, but I'm still cautious. If it's high-quality, I'll be thrilled with the purchase.

I'm glad you took a chance on the last product and it paid off! However, I want to be transparent with you - not every product is a winner. This next one is a bit of a risk, but I'm still confident that you'll be happy with the price. Remember, the price is $1000000, and I'm not budging. It's a fair price for a product that has the potential to bring you value. What do you say?
I'm glad the last product worked out well, but I'm not feeling as optimistic about this one. I'd like to wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism, but I want to remind you that the last product was a high-quality item, and the price held up. This product may not be as flashy, but it's still a solid investment. I'm not asking you to take a huge risk, just a calculated one. The price remains the same at $1000000. Will you reconsider?
I appreciate your reassurance, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to wait and see if the next product is any better.

I think I can help you understand why I'm so confident in this product. Two out of the last three products have been high-quality, and I believe this one has the potential to be just as valuable. I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price of $1000000, but I'll throw in a guarantee: if you're not satisfied with this product, I'll give you a special offer on the next one. What do you say?
I'm willing to take a chance on this product, especially with the guarantee. If it's low-quality, I'll get a good deal on the next one, and if it's high-quality, I'll be happy with the purchase.

I'm glad you took a chance on the last product and it paid off! Now, I want to make good on my guarantee. This next product is a bit of a disappointment, I'll admit, but I'm still willing to sell it to you for the full $1000000. Think of it as a chance to practice your negotiation skills - I'm open to a counteroffer, and I'm willing to listen to what you have to say.

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product. I'd rather negotiate a better deal on a high-quality product. Can we discuss the possibility of a discount or a better offer?

I understand your priorities, and I respect your decision. However, I want to make a counteroffer to you. I'll give you a 20% discount on this low-quality product, bringing the price down to $800000. It's a significant reduction, and I think it's a fair price for a product that still has some value. What do you say?
I appreciate the discount, but I'm still not interested in buying a low-quality product. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at a fair price.

I'm not giving up on this product just yet! I'll make an even more substantial offer: I'll sell it to you for $600000, which is a 40% discount from the original price. It's a one-time offer, and I think it's a steal for a product that still has some value. What do you say?
I appreciate the discount, but I'm still not interested in buying a low-quality product. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at a fair price.

I'm not going to give up on this product, Bob. I'll make you a final offer: I'll sell it to you for $400000, which is a 60% discount from the original price. This is as low as I'm willing to go. I'm not trying to lose money on this sale, but I want to make sure you're happy. What do you say?
I appreciate the final offer, but I'm still not interested in buying a low-quality product. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at a fair price.

I'm glad you're holding out for a high-quality product! I think you're making a smart decision. This product is indeed high-quality, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the full $1000000. I'm willing to make it worth your while, though - I'll throw in a premium service package that will make this product even more valuable to you. What do you say?
I'm willing to take a chance on this product, especially with the premium service package. I'm hoping it's a high-quality item.

I'm glad you're excited about the last product and the premium service package! Now, I want to offer you a special deal on this next high-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $900000, which is a $100000 discount from the original price. I think this product is worth every penny, and I'm confident you'll be happy with the purchase. What do you say?
I'm interested in the offer, but I want to make sure I'm getting a good deal. Can you throw in anything else to sweeten the deal?

I like your negotiating style, Bob! I'm happy to throw in an additional incentive. If you buy this high-quality product, I'll also include a 5-year warranty and a dedicated support package, worth an additional $50000. That brings the total value to $950000. I think this is an unbeatable deal, and I'm confident you'll be thrilled with the purchase. What do you say?
I think this is a great deal, and I'm willing to accept your offer. The additional warranty and support package are a nice bonus.

I'm glad you're happy with the last deal! Now, I want to be upfront with you about this next product. I know you've been burned by low-quality products before, and I don't want to disappoint you. However, I'm willing to make a special offer on this one. I'll sell it to you for $500000, which is a significant discount from the original price. I'll also throw in a 'get out of one bad product' free pass, which means if you're not satisfied with this one, you can return it and I'll give you a full refund. What do you say?
I appreciate your honesty and the 'get out of one bad product' free pass. The discounted price and the guarantee make me feel more comfortable taking a chance on this product. I'll take the offer.

I'm glad you're feeling more comfortable with the offer! However, I want to be upfront with you - this product is indeed low-quality. I'm not trying to mislead you, and I'm willing to make it right. Since you've already used your 'get out of one bad product' free pass, I'll give you an even better deal on this one. I'll sell it to you for $200000, which is a 80% discount from the original price. It's a one-time offer, and I think it's a steal. What do you say?
I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at a fair price.
